Yes, there are eco-friendly accommodations available on Christmas Island that align with the ethos of eco-tourism. Here are a few recommendations:

1. VQ3 Lodge: This eco-friendly lodge is located in the heart of the island and offers stunning views of the surrounding rainforest. It's built from recycled materials and uses solar power to generate energy. Additionally, the lodge has a strict recycling policy and provides guests with locally sourced organic meals. 2. Swell Lodge: This luxury eco-lodge is located on an isolated clifftop and offers breathtaking views of the Indian Ocean. The lodge is environmentally friendly, powered by solar panels and uses locally available materials to minimize its carbon footprint. Additionally, a proportion of their profits go towards conservation. 3. Driftwood Lodge: This eco-lodge is situated just off the coast in a secluded bay with pristine coral reefs. The lodge offers sustainable living practices, like the use of solar power and organic gardens, and is committed to supporting local conservation projects. 4. The Sunset: This green oasis provides Self-contained eco-accommodation accommodation in the heart of Greta Beach. The Sunset Studio, is an ecological sustainable paradise. These are just a few examples of eco-friendly accommodations on Christmas Island. When booking your accommodation, make sure to check their sustainability policies and environmental initiatives to ensure that they align with your values.
